definitions.definition: To cause (something) to change its shape into a curve, by physical force, chemical action, or any other means.
To become curved.
definitions.example: Look at the trees bending in the wind.

definitions.definition: To cause to change direction.
To change direction.
definitions.example: The road bends to the right

definitions.definition: To be inclined; to direct itself.
(usually with "down") To stoop.
definitions.example: He bent down to pick up the pieces.

definitions.definition: To bow in prayer, or in token of submission.
To force to submit.
definitions.example: They bent me to their will.

definitions.definition: To submit.
definitions.example: I am bending to my desire to eat junk food.

definitions.definition: To apply to a task or purpose.
definitions.example: He bent the company's resources to gaining market share.

definitions.definition: To apply oneself to a task or purpose.
definitions.example: He bent to the goal of gaining market share.

definitions.definition: To adapt or interpret to for a purpose or beneficiary.
To tie, as in securing a line to a cleat; to shackle a chain to an anchor; make fast.
definitions.example: Bend the sail to the yard.

definitions.definition: To smoothly change the pitch of a note.
definitions.example: You should bend the G slightly sharp in the next measure.

definitions.definition: To swing the body when rowing.
An inclination or talent.
definitions.example: He had a natural bent for painting.

definitions.definition: A predisposition to act or react in a particular way.
definitions.example: His mind was of a technical bent.

definitions.definition: The state of being curved, crooked, or inclined from a straight line; flexure; curvity.
A declivity or slope, as of a hill.
Particular direction or tendency; flexion; course.
A transverse frame of a framed structure; a subunit of framing.
Tension; force of acting; energy; impetus.
(Of something that is usually straight) folded, dented
Corrupt, dishonest
Homosexual.
Determined or insistent.
definitions.example: He was bent on going to Texas, but not even he could say why.

definitions.definition: (Of a person) leading a life of crime.
Inaccurately aimed
definitions.example: That shot was so bent it left the pitch.

definitions.definition: Suffering from the bends
High from both marijuana and alcohol.
definitions.example: Man, I am so bent right now!

definitions.definition: Any of various stiff or reedy grasses.
A grassy area, grassland.
The old dried stalks of grasses.
